verses.verse: (God’s Faithfulness to Israel) (1 Chr 16.8; Ps 145.12) O give thanks to the LORD; call on his name; make known his deeds among the peoples.
(Ps 77.12) Sing to him, sing praises to him; tell of all his wonderful works.
(Ps 33.21) Glory in his holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
(Ps 27.8) Seek the LORD and his strength; seek his presence continually.
(Ps 77.11) Remember the wonderful works he has done, his miracles and the judgments he has uttered,
O offspring of his servant Abraham, (Or Israel) children of Jacob, his chosen ones.
(Isa 26.9) He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.
He is mindful of his covenant forever, of the word that he commanded for a thousand generations,
(Gen 17.2) the covenant that he made with Abraham, his sworn promise to Isaac,
(Gen 28.13-15) which he confirmed to Jacob as a statute, to Israel as an everlasting covenant,
(Gen 13.15; 15.18) saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan as your portion for an inheritance.”
(Gen 34.30; Heb 11.9) When they were few in number, of little account and strangers in it,
wandering from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another people,
(Gen 12.17; 35.5) he allowed no one to oppress them; he rebuked kings on their account,
saying, “Do not touch my anointed ones; do my prophets no harm.”
(Lev 26.26; Isa 3.1; Ezek 4.16) When he summoned famine against the land and cut off every supply of bread, (Heb staff of bread)
(Gen 37.28, 36; 45.5) he had sent a man ahead of them, Joseph, who had been sold as a slave.
(Gen 39.20) His feet were hurt with fetters; his neck was put in a collar of iron;
(Gen 40.20, 21) until what he had said came to pass, the word of the LORD kept testing him.
(Gen 41.14) The king sent and released him; the ruler of the peoples set him free.
(Gen 41.40) He made him lord of his house and ruler of all his possessions,
to instruct (Gk Syr Jerome: Heb to bind) his officials at his pleasure and to teach his elders wisdom.
(Gen 46.6; Acts 13.17) Then Israel came to Egypt; Jacob lived as an alien in the land of Ham.
(Ex 1.7) And the LORD made his people very fruitful and made them stronger than their foes,
(Ex 1.8, 10) whose hearts he then turned to hate his people, to deal craftily with his servants.
(Ex 3.10; Num 16.5) He sent his servant Moses and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
(Ex 7-12; Ps 78.43) They performed his signs among them and miracles in the land of Ham.
(Ex 10.22; Ps 99.7) He sent darkness and made the land dark; they rebelled (Cn Compare Gk Syr: Heb they did not rebel) against his words.
(Ex 7.20) He turned their waters into blood and caused their fish to die.
(Ex 8.6) Their land swarmed with frogs, even in the chambers of their kings.
(Ex 8.16, 21) He spoke, and there came swarms of flies and gnats throughout their country.
(Ex 9.23) He gave them hail for rain and lightning that flashed through their land.
He struck their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.
(Ex 10.4; Ps 78.46) He spoke, and the locusts came, and young locusts without number;
they devoured all the vegetation in their land and ate up the fruit of their ground.
(Ex 12.29; Ps 78.51) He struck down all the firstborn in their land, the first issue of all their strength.
(Ex 12.35) Then he brought Israel (Heb them) out with silver and gold, and there was no one among their tribes who stumbled.
(Ex 12.33) Egypt was glad when they departed, for dread of them had fallen upon it.
(Ex 13.21) He spread a cloud for a covering and fire to give light by night.
(Ex 16.12ff; Ps 78.24ff) They asked, and he brought quails and gave them food from heaven in abundance.
(Ex 17.6; 1 Cor 10.4) He opened the rock, and water gushed out; it flowed through the desert like a river.
(v 8) For he remembered his holy promise and Abraham, his servant.
So he brought his people out with joy, his chosen ones with singing.
(Josh 13.7) He gave them the lands of the nations, and they took possession of the wealth of the peoples,
(Deut 6.21-25) that they might keep his statutes and observe his laws. Praise the LORD!
